intro: Astragalus lonchocarpus var. cymbocarpus, commonly known as the narrowpod milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe and grassland ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
